author: By Richard Spillett, Crime Correspondent For Mailonline
description: Lawyers acting for the serial killer told a coroner in Southport today that there is 'no likelihood' his ashes would be scattered on Saddleworth Moor.
title: Ian Brady's ashes WON'T be scattered on Saddleworth Moor

author: Lucy Clarke-Billings
description: The coroner has refused to release the body until he has assurances Brady's ashes will not be scattered on Saddleworth Moor
title: Fears killer Ian Brady to have ashes scattered on moors where he buried victims

author: Helen Pidd
description: At opening of inquest into child murdererâ€™s death, coroner says it would be offensive if ashes were taken to Saddleworth Moor
title: Ian Brady's ashes must not be scattered on moor, says coroner

author: BBC News
description: Ian Brady did not express a wish for his ashes to be scattered on Saddleworth Moor, inquest hears.
title: Ian Brady 'did not want his ashes scattered on moor', inquest hears

author: Joe Thomas
description: A reconvened inquest into his death heard that no funeral directors are willing to take the body of Brady and his ashes will not be scattered on Saddleworth Moor where his victims are buried
title: Moors Murderer Ian Brady's body is under police guard at secure hospital

author: Samuel Osborne
description: Greater Manchester Police have said they will never close the case of Moors Murder victim Keith Bennett, despite the death of Ian Brady. Martin Bottomley, head of the force's Cold Case Review Unit, said officers would act on "credible and actionable" information which would help them find the body of 12-year-old Keith. He said: "Whilst we are not actively searching Saddleworth Moors, Greater Manchester Police will never close this case.
title: Police vow to never close Moor Murders case despite Ian Brady's death
